page.title: 18Local History
page.content: This is an area steeped in the history of man. There is evidence of Neolithic activity. Bronze Age man inhabitied the area. The debris of Iron Age settlements are to be found. The Roman/Romano British presence is in evidence both in building and artifact remains. The area is traversed by an important Roman Road linking Winchester with Silchester. The area was documented in the Domesday Book and contains archeological evidence of Medieval settlements. The church at Sherborne St. John dates from circa 1150, that of Monk Sherborne is of similar date. The history of the area in the Tudor and Tudor period is entwined with the fortunes of the owners of the Vyne Estate, which were at the highest level. The area increasingly became linked with Basingstoke from then on.
